intro: Geonoma interrupta subsp. platybothros, commonly known as the broad-leafed geonoma, is a species of fern native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen fronds. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, such as forest understories. Its leaves are usually broad and leathery, with a distinctive, segmented appearance. It is often found in association with other epiphytic and lithophytic plants in its habitat.
